intro: Magnolia sanchez-vegae, commonly known as the Sánchez-Vega magnolia, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its large, showy white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture and a deep green color. The bark is smooth and light gray, often exuding a mild aromatic scent.
